admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Post-Conflict
            Rehabilitation Credit Project is assessed as satisfactory
            with likely sustainability. The project has made a
            difference on the ground and was a positive force for
            Tajikistan's movement toward peace, and, hence, toward
            creation of an enabling environment for growth. The
            assistance was successful in facilitating efforts to
            repatriate opposition soldiers, refugees, and internally
            displaced persons. Bank performance was highly satisfactory,
            while borrower performance was satisfactory. Key lessons
            learned follow. An adjustment operation with no specific
            conditionality but strong government commitment, can be
            efficacious. Flexibility and speed are critical elements for
            post-conflict rehabilitation operations. Finally, timely
            Bank support can make a major contribution to sustaining peace.
